review: Zoloft (sertraline):Zoloft was like a Savior to me I was taking 50mg a day it not only helped me get rid of depression it helped a bit to control Social Anxiety. I was hesitant but now I know it was the best choice.

Zoloft (sertraline):10/10 its really nice. I am taking 75mg a night combined with present awareness, walking, positive thinking, offering positivity to everyone everywhere I go, and healthy eating. Zoloft is incredible and a very special part of the new me. Absolutely awesome! Effects: flying high with happiness, improved focus, lots of energy. Side effects: little bit of a pit in my stomach here and there and some teeth clenching.

I took this medication after being diagnosed with OCD, GAD, and depression. It helped a lot at first but made me very sleepy and unfocused. After the first few weeks that went away but for the rest of the time I was on it, I felt very flat emotionally and often had very vivid scary dreams. After about a year of being on it, I experienced a hypomanic episode and had to discontinue.
I was prescribed 50mg sertraline back Aug 21. After years of suffering with bad depression and mood swings, this drug has really changed my life. I should have taken these years ago!

Hi all don't normally ask for advice but hoping someone can help me. My doctor as prescribed me 50mg sertraline last week there still sitting in the cupboard cause I'm too scared to start them. I'm not good with tablets tbh they make me panic. Even taking antibiotic give me anxiety also I've read all the bad reviews. Don't know if I should just start to take them as I scared of the bad reviews and scared of the side affects. Anyone have any advice ? Thankyou

Zoloft (sertraline):Hello everyone,I just wanted to thank everybody who has taken the time to write a comment on Zoloft, I  never wanted to give it a try because of the things you hear about antidepressants and their side effects etc. I will be starting on 25mg in a couple of days and I will be back in a month or so to do an update thank you again everyone and stay strong

Zoloft (sertraline):I was experiencing extreme depression bouts, and bad anxiety. Sometimes I would cry uncontrollably all day. I began 25 mg of Zoloft a little over 3 weeks ago. I am one of the rare people that noticed a change within the first few days, and it has been great the whole time so far. I feel like myself again, and have not had an emotional spiral since beginning this antidepressant. Anxiety is also much less. I anticipate my doctor will up my dose in a few more weeks, and I will probably stay on this SSRI for a while until my brain can do its job on its own. I am so glad I gave this a try. I felt so lost and alone, and thought I was going crazy. I just needed a little help.

Firstly, I would like to say overall my experience with sertraline is good. I started taking sertraline about three months ago and at first it was helping out very much, but somewhere around the last week of the first month it felt less helpful, but still helped..Then around the first week of my second month taking sertraline, I forgot to take my medication daily and constantly. So in retrospect, had I kept taking said medication I would probably felt better about it. I also declined to up the dosage on it because I wanted to see if it would help still at a lower dosage. I think I may have to up the dosage.

I have been on Sertraline 50mg for the past 7 years for depression and anxiety (I have historically suffered from both conditions).I can honestly say that the medicine has only helped me the first 6-12 months. After that, it has lost its potency, and have since then been in permanent state of depression, unable to go back to full time work, and unable to come off the med (due to severe withdraw effects), in spite of multiple attempts, with multiple tapering methods over the years. In addition, I have also been dealing with daily side effects like morning fatigue, emotional blunting and lower libido. There is no doubt, the med has done for harm than good and I have paid a huge price for that temporary relief the first 6 months.

I used to take Sertraline by Aurobindo which were fantastic, I could function,  go out and be 'Normal' but then Aurobindo was dropped for Milpharm and something changed, I'm not a chemist so I cannot say exactly what changed but something in the ingredients has been dropped because now Sertraline by Milpharm are dreadful to the point where I've stopped taking them.My experience of Milphatm's Sertraline is of confusion,  tiredness and hair loss,  they seem to cut the blood going to the top of the head and I have this weird soreness on the head and severe hair loss. Milpharm have also taken over a gastro tablet called Omeprazole from Almus which I'd take 2 tablets in the morning and id be fine all day but since Milpharm has taken over they don't work at all .I can only assume Milpharm has been on a cost cutting exercise but their actions have made their medication worse not better.

I tried taking Sertraline for a month (alongside my existing Mirtazapine) and the side effects greatly outweighed the good it was doing to my mood. In the end I couldn't work because of stomach pain, diarrhea, dizziness and nauseousness, so I had to stop taking them and now I'm trying Duloxetine.
Made me feel suicidal the moment I started taking it

I really perserved with sertraljne. But in the end it was making me so anxious. I was on for 3 months in total. I have a chronic health condition but the side effects made life impossible. The first few days I couldn't stand up without holding onto something, nausious, head exploding. The week after I started shaking constantly, my speech was so fast and my legs would move all night.I still stick with it. This was 25mg too.I started feeling a bit lighter but the anxiety just came out the blue. I had a lot of nervous energy. I upped to 50mg after 6 weeks. I  started scratching my skin in night unintentionally, it would bleed and is wake up surprisingly jump up scared. I still kept going. I was thinking about death a lot. From 6 weeks I had horrendous night sweats. I couldn't sleep properly, and this was when I decided to stop. I was scared to go out the house and crying all the time in fear. After about a week the shaking subsided. I feel better now, just very low.

I was on this medication for close to a year before I stopped taking it. When I started, the main side effects were trouble sleeping and slight nausea. The nausea went away after two or three days, but the insomnia stayed - which was unfortunate because I was suffering from an inability to fall asleep in the first place. After around 1.5 months, I started to feel the antidepressant effect of the medication to kick in. I remember walking down a road when suddenly, the sky, the sound of the birds flying above me just seemed brighter - I will never forget this feeling, and it was such a relief after suffering from major depression for quite a long time beforehand. Sertraline definitely won't "cure" your depression, but it can do amazing things in helping you get through a tough time. Still, I believe that seeking other forms of help, such as therapy, is key. I eventually discontinued this antidepressant because of the insomnia, increased anxiety and the sexual dysfunction it caused.
I’ve been taking sertraline for years and and it definitely does want it’s needed to do! However what my most doctors won’t tell you is that It affects your sex drive immensely

it helped !! >> now hear me out. I was so so sceptical because when I started sertraline I felt absolutely insane. I had these horrible suicidal panic attacks every day and felt so dissociative as if my life wasn't real. I felt completely numb to every emotion, even my girlfriend, being honest, I felt like that for a good two months and then slowly started to improve over my third month and now its finally sorted me out. I feel completely functional and have access to all of my emotions and at peace :) obviously my life still has its ups and downs, no pill is going to be a miracle otherwise everyone would be on it. But I promise you please please please be patient. It is worth hanging on. It will work, just give it time to balance out. You are putting chemicals in your brain and your body is just taking time to adjust. I know its painful I know its hard and I know you are anxious about it. I had the worst months of my life waiting for it to kick in, but it did!! It will get so much better

Zoloft (sertraline):For depression and anxiety. 50mg a day. Have been taking for almost 6 months.Overall it has helped. My moderate anxiety has definitely lessened. My depression (which I would also describe as moderate pre-Zoloft) is milder now. It took about 4 months for the side effect of occasional weird thinking to wear off, but I was drinking alcohol on zoloft for most of that time period. I haven't been drinking for the past month. The big knock on Zoloft for me (and the only reason it doesn't get a 10) is the libido side effects. It has become difficult to ejaculate, and when I do, it doesn't feel as good as it used to. Viagra helps with erection and ability to ejaculate quite a bit, but it's still not the same as pre-Zoloft. It's a trade off I guess. I have also put on quite a bit of weight, and faster than I ever have in my life. I think there's a correlation to zoloft but can't be sure.

Zoloft (sertraline):Been on it 3 months at 50mg every morning. It hasn't been extreme,  the side effects just never hit me thankfully. Of course the first day was a bit of nausea. Overall it is helping. The effects are fairly mild.  which is what I was looking for. My depression is average and not severe.  Please don't give up on yourself because with mental illness we tend to make things worse than they really are. I was also an opiate addict and if you're an addict don't expect to feel high from zoloft. At first I was craving a high from this drug, I wanted to feel so happy 24/7 but that's just ridiculous because you still need to put in the work to get this medication to work well enough that your depression subsides. You can't just pop zoloft and expect to feel happy. You have to get the ball rolling with positive thoughts and a better lifestyle. You can't take your zoloft and fall into the same pattern of laying in bed all day. You need to force effort.

Zoloft (sertraline):Zoloft is amazing! I got on it a week ago, and I was nauseous & vomiting for a few days, however, if you’re willing to ride out the side effects for a little while, this medication works wonders! It has calmed my nerves, & made me a better wife. I was accusing & interrogating my husband because my anxiety was through the roof, & suddenly, I’m not worried anymore. I still have bad days, but it has given me a better outlook on life, it has made me a better student & wife, & it has been life changing after only a week! Don’t give up! Be patient & let the medicine do it’s job!
Made me drop out of school for a year and I can’t even explain how bad it made me poop my pants
I have had regular diarrhea and delayed ejaculation after using 25mg for 10 days and then 50mg for 15 days. I have felt better - more positive but after skipping 2 days I felt very sleepy.

I started sertraline while still drinking and stayed on it through recovery. Can't say that the drug was effective during the period that I was drinking though I give the medication some credit with helping my mood and anxiety in early sobriety. Problem was that two years into sobriety it seemed the medication stopped working for depression. So I moved on to another antidepressant.

Zoloft (sertraline):My husband died a little over a year ago.  Major depression, panic, and anxiety hit me hard.  While I still am very depressed, I don’t cry all day.  A few things interest me, but for the most part, I’m just treading water.  The thing is, Zoloft makes me feel detached; it takes the edge off.

Last year I had a nervous breakdown.  I was very, very unwell almost bedridden with extreme anxiety, depression, racing thoughts, panic attacks etc. I gradually got a little better but it never fully went away. I’ve been on sertraline 50mg for almost 4 weeks now and I can’t tell you what a miracle drug it’s been for me. I’ve tried Prozac and citalopram in the past but this is bringing out the best in me. I sleep better, I have more energy during the day. I do housework, talk and spend time with my children again, I’m proactive and looking forward to the future. I haven’t felt like this in years. Anyone who’s considering it please give it a go. Everybody is different. It may not be the drug for you but it may also be the perfect drug for you. You just never know. I wish I’d taken it 10 years ago, who knows who I would be and what I would have achieved if only I’d given it a go in the beginning.

Zoloft (sertraline):After around six weeks my appetite was the first thing to come back. Suddenly, after over two months of pure nausea and vomiting due to my anxiety and depression whenever I tried to eat or think about food, I look forward to my meals again. I have seen a HUGE reduction in my intrusive suicidal thoughts. My anxiety levels have gone from an 8 to a 4. Today they were pretty much at a 2/3. I wake up and I don’t dread the day. I can think about beginning to process my emotions again. I feel hopeful about the future. This is my second time using Zoloft and this time I can see a much more noticeable effect for some reason (I think my depression was worse this time around). I stigmatised myself SO much for having to back on the SSRIs after going through the whole weaning-off process only months before, but oh my god am I glad I got over that stupid idea. Who the hell cares that you take a pill everyday! I also take a multivitamin, same difference. Do it please if you need.

In my experience, this medication dulls down all moods and emotions. I didn't feel depressed while taking sertraline, but I didn't feel happy either. In terms of side effects I experienced vivid dreams, dizziness, slowed mental processing and significantly reduced sex drive. Over 1 year after taking this medication, many of the side effects remain. I'm not sure if this is normal or not.

Have been on this medication now for 3 months.  Still have loose stools daily.  I have lows.   Some so bad I  can feel my whole body sinks.  My dark mood feels impossible to lift.  But I don't sit still.  I remember things and get things done with energy where as before I would sit or forget things.    Not sure the loose stools are worth it as I'm always hungry.  Doctor said I didn't give meds long enough to work but am thinking 3 months is long enough now but the panic of not having them for support is powerful when people don't appreciate how bad that feels.

Zoloft (sertraline):All it took was one dose to completely discombobulate me. Before this I've been anxious and depressed for weeks but yesterday I was nearly incapacitated by it so I decided I would try Zoloft to see if it would help me. This drug, a few hours after I took it, sent me into what I would describe as a mental and physical rock bottom. I felt a wave of deep sadness accompanied by an even stronger feeling of exhaustion. All I could do was sleep and cry. My mornings are normally my best hours of the day, but today, I feel empty. I just want to go back to the nightmare I am familiar with. This is straight up terrible.

Zoloft (sertraline):I’ve been suffering with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome for several years. Without this medication I would probably have ended my own life a while ago. My disease sucks, as it’s caused me to lose my career, friends, and social life. Two things are keeping me sane; my wife and Zoloft. The depressive thoughts and constant worry and anxiety about my condition has almost ceased thanks to this wonder drug. I’ve tested five other antidepressants that had little to no effect on me. For some reason, Zoloft works wonders. If you struggle from depression, do NOT give up on finding the right medication for you. There are so many options, and even though they claim to work similarly, they clearly don’t. Don’t give up. Keep fighting through. You are incredibly strong. I believe in you.

Zoloft (sertraline):Dosages:50 MG until Dec 202025 MG from December 2020 to August 9 2021, Dr's advice 50 MG from August 9 to September 9 due to stressors bringing back depression100 MG from Sept 9 to now, Dr's advice (been a little over 6 weeks)Since my 9/27 post I have been blindsided with new stressors that are preventing me from stabilizing. I can tell the Zoloft is working some of the time, as the bad feelings are sometimes dulled and I am able to function. Mornings and early afternoons remain bad times for me. Hoping for full therapeutic effect within the next two weeks, as well as hoping my life gets calmer and doesn't derail the effects.

Zoloft (sertraline):I was on Zoloft for just over a month for Borderline Personality Disorder/Depression. It was fine for the first three weeks (due to it not doing anything yet), but the moment it began to work I felt horrible. My suicidal thoughts were five times worse, and it actually made me feel MORE depressed. It was all I could do to get out of bed every morning. My sleep was horrible and I completely lost all sex drive. I also got nausea and very bad heartburn.

1st thing … IT TAKES TIME. If you’re reading this it’s because you need assurance that how you’re feeling is going to get better. It will!!! But allow 2-6 weeks to feel better. For me, I didn’t notice anything at all for 10 days. At 20 days I started feeling better. At about 30-40 days my depression was so much better. I still get a little anxious but nothing compared to how I was when I was EXTREMELY depressed. You will get better, it takes time and that part sucks but trust me you will get better! This medication is a LIFE SAVER.
Zoloft (sertraline):definitely works, but I have experienced bloating/weight gain.....

Zoloft (sertraline):Unfortunately, while Zoloft (first 50mg daily and then 100mg and then back to 50mg) did work for my depression and OCD at the 100mg dose, it also came with a lot of side effects for me - nauseous stomach, diarrhea, weight loss, lack of energy, and temporary short-term memory loss.  All of these side effects went away when I went off Zoloft.  I am amazed with how much better I feel without it.  I now take another antidepressant (Paroxetine 20mg daily) that actually has a side effect of moderate constipation, which I will gladly take, and it is working well right now for the depression and OCD.  I now have more energy as well.

I have been on Sertraline for 3 weeks now. I started on 25mg for the first week and then 50mg. I can honestly say I felt better within days of starting this medication. My depression and anxiety were getting really bad and I was also having suicidal thoughts. So far I have not had any side effects other than waking up really early but I haven't slept well in years. I honestly feel happier and my anxiety is much better. I will stick with 50 mg for now and increase to 100mg if I start to feel depressed again.

Zoloft (sertraline):I have always struggled with depression and anxiety but I had a bit of depression that had left me in my bed for six months. I decided to go to my doctor. I had previously (2 years prior) taken Citalopram I didn’t like the sexual dysfunction symptoms. I was given 50mg Sertraline (Zoloft). I felt awfully fatigued and tired the first time I took it as well as dizzy and spaced out (would recommend not driving!). This continued over the next few weeks, I constantly felt sick and didn’t want to eat, felt out with my body. I stuck with it and by the 5th week I was feeling less side effects but still felt it wasn’t touching my depression. I went to the doctor and got 100mg. After about 2 months I felt happy for the first time ever. It was a strange feeling, and my thoughts drifted to moments of almost ‘eurphoa’ to be experienced for a few minutes. Would recommend starting on the lowest dose and building up. Still sexual dysfunction side effects but worth it.

I’ve been on sertraline for years. I always end up talking to my psychiatrist and asking them to start something new. I never go through with it. But this medicine makes my head hurt worse than it did at first. I think my dosage is wrong
It didn’t work it made me feel even worse than I did before taking it. Not only did it negatively impact my mental health even more but my physical as well. I got so extremely sick.

Zoloft (sertraline):I have depression, GAD and OCD and I was prescribed Zoloft by my nurse practitioner. I feel lucky that this is the first drug I tried for my depression and it worked for me. I was in a very dark place and decided to get on medication, and now I really do feel like myself again. My advice: START SLOW. Slower than you think you need to! I started with 12.5 mg and then worked my way up to my current 50 mg over the course of a few weeks. It was a bit of an adjustment starting out but nothing crazy because I started so low. I have now been on 50 mg for about 6 months and I think I may ask to go up to 100, since I do still feel depressed from time to time. But 100 is a pretty normal dose for an adult.

Zoloft (sertraline):I agree completely with the other post regarding healing being holistic. Medicine is sometimes necessary, but isn't the only remedy. I also use a holistic approach. Exercise, meditation, self care, fresh air, soul nurturing, healthy thinking. And I also. Absolutely swear by my Zoloft. It returned me to myself. For me, it does not create apathy, I still feel deeply, cry, and love hard. But I stopped feeling that dark cloud of foreboding. I also felt weak, like I should be able to figure another way to fix my problem.But I learned that strength is in humility. In self awareness. And in seeking healing to be your best self. Zoloft brought me back. I wish you luck finding that peace.

I been on this for five weeks now at 50mg . My doc tried to increase my dose felt awful so went back down to 50mg . I feel so rubbish cry each morning my life has no meaning . Scared of my family coming to see me.  Does anyone  else  felt like this? so restless?

Zoloft (sertraline):I have always been a worrier ever since I can remember. I believed I was going to stay this way my entire life until I was prescribed with Zoloft 50mg.Starting a full time job at 21, I used to constantly experience heart palpitations, I would ruminate constantly (day in and out), I began picking at my skin/nails. Life was absolutely exhausting for me. I saw a therapist who helped identify my anxiety triggers and I was given propranolol.These methods did help but not completely. My doctor started me on 25mg of sertraline and it increased my levels of anxiousness. Feeling hopeless I came across this page and read all your reviews and that gave me so much strength. I am currently on week 6 of Zoloft, taking 50mg. And l couldn’t be happier! I honestly feel like myself again, I can laugh at jokes now, I can rest easy and I’m not worrying at all anymore - it’s as if all the thoughts have been put on mute.Give it a go please, it’ll save your life

Zoloft (sertraline):I have a long history with Zoloft, mostly successful, with a couple of self-inflicted bumps in the road. I do have issues with weight, low libido and lethargy on this drug. I had been doing well on 25mg since December (after being on mostly 100mg the previous 20 years). Then some big stressors came my way in late July and my old major depression came back. Basically feeling paralyzed and unable to enjoy anything.  Back in December my dr had said I could increase to 50mg if necessary, so I started doing so on Aug 9. The depression had not abated by the time I saw the dr again on Sep 9. He recommended going up to 100mg until I felt better from the serotonin stabilizing. I had a breakthrough one week later (Sep 16) where I finally felt much better. But that lasted only a week and I started feeling bad again three days ago (Sep 25). So I’m just waiting for it to kick in again so I can hopefully go back down to 50mg. Struggling with insomnia as well.

Zoloft (sertraline):I think this drug has saved my life. I suffer from major depressive disorder, GAD, and PTSD. For 3 years I had been trying so many medications. I had actually tried Zoloft before and it didn't work, but this time it has worked better than any other meds have. Just a month ago I had nearly attempted suicide again and I thought it was the end. Now I have more hope for the future and I am working on healing. Although it has made my memory a bit fuzzy and gave me headaches for a little while it is working. I do struggle a bit more with anxiety and insomnia, but my depression has improved and I finally went back to school. My flashbacks have eased off as well. Please be patient and try it!

I had acute MDD and was prescribed 100mg Pristiq after taking a DNA test. I had no problems with Pristiq and it helped at first, but then I kept having down days, even after taking it for close to two months. By accident I found that the tablet, which is extended release, was not always absorbing before passing in the stool. So I started supplementing 100mg Pristiq with 50mg Zoloft and immediately I felt better and had no more down days. Eventually I increased Zoloft to 100 and Pristiq to 50 and that worked great for two months. Now I just take Zoloft 100 every night. The only side effect that I recall from Zoloft was a loss of appetite for about 5 days. I lost about 4 lbs. so it worked out. I can miss a dose of Zoloft, or take a little less or a little more and have no problems.

Sertraline 25mg makes me not give a damn about anything or care about whats going on around me. I still think negatively of everything and I worry more. Because I got used to 25mg so now I take 2 25mgs a day and I just feel empty and my health is also bad so that might be the reason.

I had the best experience on sertraline. Yes the side effects at the beginning were awful, dizziness, light headed, feeling like a zombie, but it was worth it for getting back to myself within 6 weeks of starting them. Prior to starting them I couldn't get myself out of bed or look after myself, then with the help of sertraline I was back to "normal". I've recently come off them after 3 years but just really wanted to share my positive experience. Tapering off them wasn't as bad as starting them.

A little over a year ago, I was prescribed Zoloft for my social anxiety and depression. I started out with 25mg, and am now taking 100mg daily. So far it has worked quite well for me. I can remember how depression ruined everything I enjoyed in life. Every day felt like I was trying to move with a ball and chain wrapped around my ankles. It was hard for me to start getting medicated (because of personal reasons), but once I did, I could see that Sertraline began to help in little ways. I wouldn’t cry so much. I was able to pick up some of my hobbies again to a certain degree. And other than having low libido and tiredness, I had no nasty side effects. My only problem would be that my social anxiety didn’t seem to improve as much as I’d hoped. Nonetheless, I was happy enough with the results I did get.Overall I wouldn’t say it’s a miracle drug, but it definitely made my life easier to live. It’s worth a try, any help is better than nothing at all.

After crying every day for a couple of months my doctor put me on this. Then within a couple of weeks I stopped crying and reached a point in my mind where I rationalised what was upsetting me and how I could deal with it. For me this is an effective drug- a missing link I didn’t actually have neurologically.

This pill has saved me, I feel like myself again. I can’t believe it took me so long to take and remove the stigma of antidepressants in my own mind. There are some minor side effects and I find if I take it late at night it affects my sleep but the benefits far outweigh these. Has removed all my anger symptoms associated with depression. I feel lighter and am able to control my emotions much more.

Zoloft (sertraline):HiI have been on Zoloft 200 mg for 25 years. At first I found it great, started on 25mg then 50 mg to 100 mg to 200 mg. In the beginning I suffered from major depression and after trying a few drugs Zoloft was the only one that worked. After about 5 years on it I started getting panic attacks and severe anxiety attacks, feeling worse then ever. I found out from my doctor that been on it long term causes this, it’s part of the side affects. I stuck with it and got some counselling and it went away until recently. This time it was unbearable. Trying to come off them is absolutely horrible, I was so sick, I thought I might of had to check my set into a hospital.  I was suicidal, dizzy,I was  all over the place, vomiting, shaking, hot and cold, crying constantly, irritable, It was bad

Good, really helped calm me down and assess stress differently and more effectively, but gained a lot of weight in a year, 3 stone to be exact, 1 year now off sertraline and I’ve only managed to loose half a stone. The weight gain for me made it not worth taking!
Zoloft (sertraline):It made me feel like a zombie. Suicidal but can't cry, sad but can't feel it enough to process it, AWFUL

Zoloft (sertraline):I need to preface this review that I am taking it in conjunction with 2 MG of Abilify. I take both Abilify at 2 Mg and Zoloft at 50 Mg Daily. The first 12 days are pretty rough. The first week in particular i experienced plenty of side affect, the loss of appetite the numbness and just a general depressive state. Now on day 14 I'm starting to feel a general sense of returning to the person I used to be. A sense of confidence and pride have returned to me. I can't recommend it without the Abilify for me. That is why it gets an 8/10 and not a straight 10.

I'm so happy I've found this site. I'm 56, male,  and suffered from anxiety and depression all my life,  I've tried all kinds of  antidepressants, and all have failed. My gp recommended  sertraline, 50mg,.. I can't  believe the difference  it has made. I feel alive, I don't turn to the wine as I did before,  I've been on this for 3 weeks and already feeling my old self, which I  haven't felt in years and years,  little few early side effects,  but hey, that's nothing compared to how I was. Please just give it a try

Zoloft (sertraline):Works great for me!I started taking this after my son passed away from suicide.  I am on a very low dose (6.25 mg).  I had to go to a specialty pharmacy to get this dose.  I am very sensitive to medicine.First week:  Felt hopefulSecond week:  Felt slightly more depressedThird week:  Back to normalFourth week:  Slight improvement in moodFifth/sixth week:  Much betterSide effects:  None at allOther coping mechanisms:  Eating well, sleeping well, regular exercise, a therapist, a grief support group, a men's group, my dogs, talking about things with friends and family, staying open to my feelings.  Overall:  I am so happy I am taking this!  My story shows that starting on a very low dose (which I don't see a need to increase now) can bring great improvements without any side effects.  Hang in there!  It does take time but it works great after about a month or so.  And, work on your other coping mechanisms as well!  Love to all of you!

Zoloft (sertraline):This drug saved my life after experiencing a downward spiral and being plagued with recurrent suicidal ideations. After a few weeks on it initially, I started feeling functional again and finally started enjoying life again. I switched to Pristiq only because I started recognizing fatigue, likely associated with this drug.

Zoloft (sertraline):hi guys, I promised I would come back and leave a review after trying zoloft. I am female (21) and I have been diagnosed with depression, anxiety, and post traumatic stress disorder from a car crash. I read SO many reviews talking about their horrible crazy experiences so I was super scared to try this. I’m on 25mg of zoloft daily which I believe is the lowest dose. It has worked wonders for me. PLEASE GIVE IT A TRY. The first night I took it without food and I was up all night extremely nauseous with a crazy amount of energy. definitely take it in the morning. The only annoying side effects I've experienced are mild nausea if i take it without food and lower libido. This pill has changed my life and honestly saved my life. I am so much more productive and energetic, I no longer have racing thoughts and cry for hours every night. I feel like myself again, and I feel like my best self. I wish you all the best luck on your journey. You are so loved !!!!

Zoloft (sertraline):I started taking this drug. In the first two weeks. I noticed a big change. I was happier than I had ever been. But as time went on. I was too happy. I started to think that maybe this happiness was a little too fake. My senses had become altered to where, I felt wasn't right. For example, this sounds bad, but this is what was happening to me. For example: if something really bad happened to someone I probably would laugh at that. Zoloft desensitized my brain into thinking I could do no wrong. That I was invincible. That scared me. And after I stopped taking it. And when it finally wore off. I could see that the drug was very dangerous to keep taking for me. In my experience I feel is was permanently damaging my brain. Because I couldn't think like I did before I started taking the drug. I could remember a lot of things before I took the drug. I've been having problems remembering anything after stopping the drug.   It worked way too well to be a miracle drug. It does make you happy.

I am in my 3rd week, and like many people, I too was desperate for hope and information. After leaving my job, my anxiety and depression escalated from manageable to severe. I spent a week sobbing, couldn’t get out of bed, and had horrible GI issues. I finally decided that I needed help to get myself out of this hole, and started sertraline. For one week I took 25mg, and didn’t notice much of a difference. I then started 50mg, and had horrible side effects- terrible nausea, hot and cold chills, insomnia that woke me up every hour, upset stomach and bathroom issues; I felt like I had the flu and could barely get through the day. I was so desperate for relief and on day 9, I finally felt better! I’ve also noticed that my mood is much more stable, and I feel like I’m getting back to myself. I know it will be a few more weeks until I can truly evaluate if this medication is effective, but I wanted to give hope to anyone going through the symptoms of starting this medication.
Zoloft (sertraline):It doesn’t work

I have had depressive periods for the last 20 years. I have tried a lot of non-medical common treatments to fight the most recent depressive phase that kicked in 1.5 years ago, none of which really stuck.I have also tried (for about 3 months each) the following anti-depressants before taking sertraline: Citalopram, Escitalopram, Wellbutrin and Lithium. I started taking Sertraline 4 weeks ago, was on 25mg for two weeks and then increased the doses to 50 mg. The week in which I increased the doses was very hard (extreme mood swings, tiredness, highly emotional incl. tears) but after that I adjusted well to the medication and I am very happy so far (headaches, tiredness, low mood has all been significantly reduced and I do not feel any significant side effects).I did not have any hope in medications after I did not respond well to four of them, but to keep going, try different medications and give it some time does pay off. There is a suitable treatment out there for everyone!!

It's done little if anything to help my depression or anxiety. I'm on the highest dose 100mg and I don't feel it doing anything. Still have days where I can't get out of bed, don't take care of myself etc.

Promised to do a review after taking this since I read so many. I was incredibly scared to start sertraline after reading countless reviews about the permanent side effects (especially sexual), but I am so glad I went with it anyways. 1 month into taking it regularly, and the worst side effect I got were some stomach cramps in the first 2 days. Mood is lifted, less hopelessness, no loss of libido.

I've been through so many antidepressants and none of them worked.  One I was on for 7 months which CAUSED anxiety and didn't touch my depression.  The psychiatrist who was doling out the meds never jumped in and said "Hey - This isn't working. Let's do something else". Just kept trying to fix the anxiety.  The day after I stopped the drug - Viibryd - anxiety dropped 75%.  Now she wants me to start Sertraline.  I am so SCARED. Somebody please give me some encouragement.  I'm about to lose my mind.

overall: ehI got the sertraline prescribed for depression specifically (that was the biggest issue at the time), but was essentially a sugar pill for that at 200mg reduced Social Anxiety by about 40% and non-complex PTSD symptoms about the same. It did nothing for/maybe made disordered eating worse in hindsight? Also helped reduce complex PTSD symptoms by maybe 10%. a lot of GI side effects but nothing intolerable. If your main issue is anxiety, even from multiple sources, I'd say it's a good bet

Zoloft (sertraline):Zoloft really help me out my life back on track. I was hesitant at first reading through the side effects and put it off for a while. Once the therapist convinced me and I got on, it took me about a month to notice the effects. I just had some appetite suppression for the first weeks but that went away. It really feels like the was a missing puzzle piece in my life and I haven’t looked back since. (50mg)

Although most people in my sphere are prescribed amphetamine based meds, my doctor wanted to get me to try Zoloft for my Adult ADHD and depression. Because of my body chemistry, adjusting to the medication and withdrawl is pretty much a nightmare. But it has  been a godsend with regular prescribed usage for years now at 75mg daily. Living a fairly normal life now

Zoloft (sertraline):DONT GIVE TO CHILDRENI'm just glad I was able to start weaning off of them while I still have time to turn my life around (aged 20). I have noticed my drive for all things in life has come back after a decade of walking purgatory.  Recollection of the 10 years I was on this drug is difficult, meaning most memories of my childhood are hazy at best, I feel cheated of my formative years and sad that the psychiatric community didn't care about the well being of me and countless other children who just needed talk therapy after trauma.  The worst part is that I thought this was how life was supposed to be and that it was helping me, nobody knew how awful it was not even me.

I have been on sertraline 50mg for over a month now. I can say the first 10 days for me were awful, with shaking, insomnia, jittery and feeling sick. These side effects went away after 10 days. I found that these have worked better than citolapram. I haven't yet seen much of a change but I am giving it a chance to settle in before I go to a higher dose. Anyone experiencing much change??
I took this med for 15 days and  it did nada.  After I quit (roughly 2 weeks ago) I feel terrible. I lost my sense of taste and my depression is WORSE.Never again will I try an antidepressant.

Zoloft (sertraline):I've gained weight, but this is the only med that has worked for me - so far. I tried wellbutrin and found that it did not help me at all. I will say my anxiety could be better so I am looking for something else currently.
Helped with the depression. My lows were gone, but the negative effect it had was that I seemed to care less and got irritated and angry faster and over littler things.

I am suffering from depression and anxiety. My illness is genetic.My mother is a patient of bipolar, depression. It is my 9th week on this med (sertaline) 50mg. 1 week I was feeling like someone who wasn't even living,c ontinuously looking at walls.  I have had no physical side effects.  After 3 weeks I started feeling good,  I  was not crying without reason, and my sleep was also improved. I am still taking 50mg but I am not feeling much better. I'm feeling emotionless, not enjoying anything. I still have some tablets so I will try sertraline  for one more month.

Zoloft (sertraline):I’m diagnosed with ADHD, Depression, GAD and mild PTSD. To say my mind is chaos 75% of the time is an understatement. Lol I’ve been on 20mg IR Adderall 2xDay for 2 years and began 50mg Zoloft towards the end of last year. From my experience, I don’t suggest taking the two medications at the same EXACT time because the Zoloft kicked the Adderall into high gear for me but not in a good way. It led to increased anxiety/emotions and an intense feeling of uneasiness throughout my body especially in the initial stage of Zoloft/going through the purge. Eventually the side effects ceased and I even decided to stop taking it for a month because I thought I didn't feel the benefits to my anxiety. Now I’m back on it because I feel even worse off of it and I’m giving it some time. I’ll gradually increase my dosage to try to get to a place of calm like the other reviewers. & also look for another therapist that’s experienced in MI/CBT to help me manage life together :)

I was prescribed 50mg sertraline in May 2020. I’d had bouts of depression on and off since my teens. I’m now early 40s.I began to feel very out of control last year. I kept raging at my husband, usually around my period. My relationship was at breaking point. The effects were subtle. I didn’t feel particularly happy but after a week or 2, I realised that the negative thoughts had gone away. It was such a relief. At first I had some stomach issues and kept dozing off in the evening, low libido and difficulty climaxing. All ok now though. I definitely eat more - I’ve put on half a stone but It’s changed life for the better. I no longer feel like depression was my fault. I had a health problem where I didn’t produce enough of some neurochemical, or perhaps reabsorbed it too quickly. Now with medicine, I can treat it and be healthy and normal. I wish I’d  sought help yrs ago.
This gave me permanent tinnitus and destroyed by perfectly good ears!

I personally did not benefit a whole lot from this medication during my time on it; initially (within the first few months) I felt an increase in my mood and a bit less anxiety, but truly it was mostly if not all due to the fact I was beginning to see a therapist after years of dealing with dysthymic depression without outside support or counseling. A major factor that might’ve lead to this medication not working for me is that I am quite overweight, starting the medication at around 230lbs, and at that amount of body mass, medications tend to be less effective in the body. I thankfully did not have any bad reactions or side effects, but it was not all that helpful for me, even at max dosage.

Zoloft (sertraline):I started taking Zoloft 6 months ago due to extreme depression and generalized anixety disorder (too much overthinking and worrying due to over thinking) been prescribed with 25mg. It has helped me a lot. Though I still feel depressed from time to time. Still get anxious and insomnia. This is NOT the first time I have taken Zoloft. The first time I was a child (bad idea) for sure I had a higher dosage due to that had and serious episode. After that around the age of 18-20 I took it the first 4 days (am) caused me to have a serious Panic Attack at the middle the night. I stopped taking it. It was a very low dosage. Nothing bad happen, though I had suicidal ideas. It has not been easy. All I can say is life is not easy. Never will be, but let us be positive and make the most of it. Be thankful for the good days.

I was diagnosed with depression so my doc prescribe me with Sertraline. I was on it for 3 years. However, major weight gain and fatty liver. One month ago, my body shut down. I saw my doc, blood test, extremely elevated alkaline phosphatase, I was experiencing for past 3 years all side effect (dry mouth, weight gain, fatty liver etc...). I stop cold turkey Sertraline immediately as it felt like it was really bad for me. For 5 days, no symptoms, then hot strikes, peaks and valleys, major vertigo, feeling impaired all the time. New blood test, alkaline phosphorous dropped rapidly below 400 in less than 2 weeks. But brain still feel foggy, clear at time during short time getting longer and longer. I am now drinking lots of milk to repair damage between bone and muscle. I exercise 45minutes every 3 days.

Zoloft (sertraline):I likely have permanent tinnitus. Was on it up to 150mg. I developed tinnitus at 75mg and she said it should help and to keep taking it. It's been a few months since I quit. I had to taper myself. Ugh. What an awful drug. At least I lost 20 pounds. I have insane headaches now from the tinnitus.

It was my third time of moderate to severe depression episode and anxiety disorder within 10 years due to a break up and anxiety due to some stress full events. My friend sertraline came to rescue me again from this monster depression. All of the 3 times within 10 years that I used sertraline I had the same symptoms. Diarrhea for a week, excessive depression and more anxiety for around 10 days after the first dosage and reduced libido for approx 3 weeks. My depression was eliminated within 6 weeks and the anxiety within 3 weeks. I am back to my old self again and I am so happy about this. I occasionally get intrusive thoughts about my ex but not to the extend to bother me anymore. Sertraline is a miracle. The first 2-3 weeks are harsh but then it helps you reclaim yourself from this monster depression!! Thank you sertraline once more.

Zoloft (sertraline):One of the worst, if not THE worst, experiences of my life was taking that drug and slowly losing my mind after an initial period of having it make me feel better.  It has been almost two years since quitting and I still have not fully recovered, though things are much smoother.  My motivation for life has been wrecked.  Total time taking drugs (all prescription psych meds) is at least 10 to 15 years.  They might make the clouds roll away and make you feel so much better for a while, perhaps years, but they have the very real possibility of destroying your life. If you are considering using zoloft, PLEASE google "antidepressants ruined my life" and enter the dark world of people whose lives have been destroyed by these drugs. Psych meds promise relief, but using them is playing russian roulette with your brain  and you may be one of the people who are going to wish you had never touched them. The experience has been a mental and emotional nightmare unlike anything I've ever been through.

Zoloft (sertraline):Everyone on the net dosen't talk about the truthThis piece of stuff slows you down and you have extreme loss of coordination.   You cannot play video games on this.  ( CANNOT ) It improved my mood but I can't do anything I wasnt to because I and sooo slow now. It's extremely frustrating because no one mentions all thisIf you want to be a retard. Zoloft if the best option for you !

Zoloft (sertraline):Absolutely terrible. Ever since I started it my anxiety has been through the roof I haven't washed my hair in around a month haven't gone out. I've been having severe panic attacks with it and I eventually ended up nearly going to the hospital due to severe panic attacks. I'm back on citalopram since a week ago so I'm waiting for that to kick in right now.

Zoloft (sertraline):I had just had a baby in June 2016. There were some up and downs post partum that were manageable. But in 2018 my relationship was suffering with my boyfriend and after turning 36 my emotions lost control. I was crying over things that were so little compared to things that would normally make me cry. I was so stressed out with work and feeling guilty all the time. I finally saw my primary doctor and could not explain without crying in front of her the anxiety I felt most days. She started me on Zoloft 25mg daily for 3 days and then 50mg daily from then on. After 2 months I felt a huge difference. No more crying and I felt more mellowed. My relationship ended with my boyfriend and I think that helped as well. It’s been 2 years on the Zoloft and I will continue because I do feel better than before. I will say that I ran out of pills and didn’t take them for 7 days. I felt like I was walking sideways and dizzy spells. So be cautious.

My doc put me on sertralineo treat increased depressive symptoms during my pregnancy. My symptoms were irritability, agitation, isolation, apathy, crying spells, and general lack of excitement about my pregnancy despite it being planned. I'd never taken any medication for depression or anxiety before this and doc put me on 50mg and I can say its helped me significantly. I am more patient and less reactive. I felt better than I think I did even before the pregnancy. I remember when I realized it was working, I was joking around with my 12 year old and thought, wow is this what normal moms feel like? I'm not faking this or waiting for the moment to end so I can go watch my show.  I'm just enjoying it with my kid. This has been a game changer for me. I experienced some side effects but they are all subsiding. The nausea was bearable, I got headaches off and on that were manageable with tylenol and had a few bouts of diarrhea. The worst was probably the insomnia.

Zoloft (sertraline):I have a lot of problems. Depression was one of my worst, I stayed in bed all day, cried most of the time, didn’t take care of myself etc. My psychiatrist prescribed me Zoloft and after a few weeks there was a noticeable difference! I was quite pleased, things seemed easier to do and I still have trouble with basic things but it’s much more manageable now. Like I can help myself whereas before I was just stuck. I take 200mg daily. One tip of advise I have for medications in general: You should feel something from them. You should notice a before and after (after giving it time to kick in of course). I’m not sure if this is just common knowledge but I wish someone had told me. I spent a lot of time taking medications in the past that did nothing for me but I thought surely they must be doing something. Once I took a medication that actually worked I was like woah okay this is how it’s supposed to be.

I was diagnosed with depression a few months back and prescribed 50mg Sertraline. As others have described, I started on these when it seemed like my life was falling apart around me. Bit by bit, I have been trying to get myself back on track, but I noticed I really lacked focus, motivation and a general desire to do anything. Things I used to enjoy became a chore, my house is my palace and it hadn't been cleaned for months, I simply didn't feel like me, I felt as if I was wearing a heavy blanket which weighed me down, fogged my mind and literally blurred my vision.  I stopped taking the meds at the start of the week, now on day 3 I have cleaned my house and planning to go for a run later, something I simply would not have contemplated last week - only 3 days I know, but I feel like I have found myself again - I won't be taking any more, they just dampened my emotions when things were really bad, but now I would rather feel something than nothing at all......

Zoloft (sertraline):Zoloft 50mg was the first medication I tried after being diagnosed with major depression, generalized anxiety, social anxiety, panic disorder, specific phobia, and OCD. It didn't do much for me, and I continued on a downward decline and experienced suicidal ideation and some of the worst anxiety of my life. It's unclear whether the medication sparked this, or if my dose was too low and it just failed to prevent this. Zoloft made me nauseous and I felt very "meh" while taking it. This might be the medication for you, but I'd be very wary of taking it, especially in the first few weeks.

Zoloft (sertraline):I went to the doctor for anxiety  and was prescribed Lexpro which has worked in the past for me, but for some reason it didn’t work this time. The doctor had me stop Lexpro  immediately and start 25 mg of Zoloft. I started on  25 mg and increased over the next 4 weeks to 150mg. Let me just say the next few weeks was horrible and reading these reviews encouraged me and made me want to push through. I skipped over all the bad reviews to stay focus.  I took Xanax at night just to help sleep but just bared through the day with nothing. I had lost 27 pounds in 5 weeks. I was beginning to think it wasn’t going to work. On the 5th week I got up and couldn’t walk. Let me just say I felt a big difference going into the 6 week.   The medicine finally  kicked in. God heals by miracles and by medicine
3 months, on 100mg sertraline, pretty much no effect at all on my depression - feels useless.
Zoloft (sertraline):Saved my life from a very dark place.

Zoloft (sertraline):I have gained 2 stone in 1 year from taking this med. I am calmer than before but the weight gain is making me depressed again. So feel like it is pointless taking this. Going to get my doctor to start taking me off this.

I was put on sertraline for my depression. I would never recommend this. Yes apparently it gets worse before it gets better, after months and my dosage being increased to the maximum, I had completely lost myself.I could not physically get out of bed most days without a panic attack. I had never experienced these before. I would be shaking and couldn’t do the things I had previously done in my day to day life. I felt tired and sick constantly.I honestly don’t believe I’d be here today if I made the decision to stop taking them.

I had no drive to do anything,  the thought of doing the dishes would make me cry, that's not normal for me as I used to have a spotless house! I finally decided to try Zoloft. For me the first 4/5 weeks made my depression & anxiety way worse, I stuck with it and I'm thankful I did as I'm now much happier & life changing. The only thing I would keep in mind is to have Xanax for the beginning if you need it until your body is used to it(maybe not for everyone)

I started using sertraline on December 23rd for mild depression it felt a little strange at first but nothing too bad, then by Boxing Day I had the most severe depression and anxiety that I could ever imagine I felt that my depression had worsened and was worried that it was at a whole new level. Myself and family suffered like this till January 2nd when I decided to stop taking it and the effects started to subside. I wasn’t informed of the side effects of this drug and was at breaking point be very careful taking this it’s extremely dangerous if not given the right information.
Zoloft (sertraline):Zoloft worked well for depression . Took it for 8 months . Little weight gain and sleepy after waking up .
Zoloft (sertraline):I felt nothing changed... Same as before. I’m looking for some advice to replace it.

Zoloft (sertraline):Just started college recently so I decided to start on Zoloft in order to manage my depression and anxiety in time for school. The first two weeks were hard as I was very nauseous as I was adjusting from 25 mg to 50 mg but that went away after my body adjusted. Shortly after, I started experiencing emotional blunting and numbness which is something that I don't like because I am a very emotional person and I need to let a good cry out sometimes but on the medication I felt very numb. I also started experience extreme sexual side effects, which is VERY common for Zoloft so I decided to switch medications. Ultimately, the side effects were not worth it.

Zoloft (sertraline):I've only been on this medication for 5 or 6 days and the adjustment period has been horrible. I've been having severe anxiety and flu symptoms. I am slowly getting better but the adjustment period is just so awful. So beware of this

Sharing my positive experience as the reviews on here had left me almost too scared to start taking sertraline!40yrs old with depression and anxiety. Started 50mg of sertraline 5.5 weeks ago.Day 1: Felt pretty rubbishy physically and was wide awake all night.Week 1: Lost my appetite and struggled to eat. Would advise others that a few days off work should be planned for.Weeks 2-5: Fatigue and a terrible jaw ache/headache caused by jaw clenching/teeth grinding. Bought a mouth guard to sleep in which helped.Week 5: Physical side effects have pretty much all gone.I had no negative mental side effects. Almost immediately I felt my anxiety lift. I can shake off a bad thought instead of it opening the door to a million bad thoughts. I have still had down days but we've had a terrible Covid/Brexit time so I suspect it is normal to feel fed up! Will have to judge this over a longer time. All in all, I am so glad I started taking it.
Terrible drug - it gives you chronic  diarrhoea embarrassing  enough to make you more depressed

I'm pregnant and suffering from perinatal depression, so my doctor told me to start sertraline. I started it with no preconceptions & the doctor said I might be irritable the first week. Almost immediately I had physical anxiety I have never experienced in my whole life. Over the next week, this turned into a deep hole of depression so bad I spent Christmas day staring out a window and crying. This coupled with the unbearable anxiety made me literally feel like I was going insane. I knew that it would make you feel worse before it worked, but this was dangerous & intolerable. I didn't laugh for a week. I had absolutely zero joy. I couldn't focus long enough to even watch TV. I decided to stop and Boxing Day I ended up in hospital because I was so inconsolable and terrified. They were amazing & supported my decision to stop the med. I'm taking Valium as needed to get me through the days until this awful drug is out of my system. I wish I'd never touched the stuff.

Zoloft (sertraline):A few a year ago I smoked a high strain of cannabis and a few days later started to have severe anxiety, something triggered and I went into a deep depression. I was living the life, amazing career and beautiful girlfriend, everything I could ask for. Then this hit and I was so deep into depression that I didn't want to continue anymore. Antidepressants were my last choice, and THANKFUL I did. I didn't want to get on them because I thought I was weak and couldn't get over it on my own. Symptoms were high depersonalization and feeling detached, hopelessness, isolation, etc. I thought it was over at age 24... but listen... It's not. I am living the best life now and have my dream job. Antidepressants do not make you weak. They make you brave and proud of yourself at the end of it. I have become a better person from all of this and you will too. Do not give up, because you will be back to normal. It took a good 6 - 8 months before they did their job. It takes awhile to kick in.

Zoloft (sertraline):I always was scared to take an antidepressant, just because of the side effects . Zoloft is not that bad, as soon as I took it my mind and my thoughts calm. I did have few side effects, dizziness and nausea. I had to take few days off from work to get used to the medicine. I recommend to be with someone, taking the medicine. Also, do the homework and eat well and some kind of physical activity. Be patient with this medication. Good luck !

Zoloft (sertraline):I used this for over a year and it seemed like it was actually working at first, but then I just ended up flatlining.... I still relapsed twice while I was on it as well, it honestly did nothing for me. On top of that, the side effects I had while transitioning onto it were absolutely terrible. I threw up so much and had diarrhea. On top of that, I just generally felt awful for about a week.  I'm finally switching to lexapro today, so I'm really hoping for better

Zoloft (sertraline):Have been on Bupropion 300mg for about a year for Depression/anxiety/SAD, which helped SAD and general dysphoria. Spoke to therapist about anxiety of selling home and loss of work due to age and he prescribed 150mg Zoloft which made me lethargic and disinterested in activities. Have gone to 75mg, better alertness, although some constipation, unsure if it's from Zoloft or bupropion. Anxiety and depression reduced overall.

Zoloft (sertraline):20 year old male. I've been on Zoloft  for 10 weeks with no benefit. I went up to 150mg about a week ago and I am hoping this one makes the difference. Haven't had many side effects besides derealization, although I had that before I guess too.  I amreally hoping it starts to work out soon.

Zoloft (sertraline):I went to the doctor over panic attacks and my mind always going to the worse scenario about every situation. He suggested Zoloft 12.5mg for a week then move the dosage up to 25mg the following week. I'm guessing it was about day 2-3 I started having insomnia, nausea through the night and mornings, brain fog, heighten anxiety, and depression. I stayed on the medication for a total of 8 days and just couldn't take the side effects any longer especially the isomnia it was taking a toll on me. I went back to the doctor and he prescribed Klonopin for sleep which worked really well and it took care of my insomnia and wanted me to try Celexa. I gave it a few weeks before I started the Celexa because I just wanted to feel somewhat normal again. I currently started the Celexa on day 2  currently with no side effects so far. Hopefully, nausea stays away and I feel the Klopodin at night will take care of my insomnia if I have any.

Zoloft (sertraline):I’m 28, 106 lbs & never taken anything like this before. I went through a very bad breakup which I think led to me having a couple of mild panic attacks. After the 2nd panic attack I saw a psychiatrist. He told me that if we could deal with my mild depression that the anxiety/panic attacks would go away. He started me on 50mg of Zoloft. I’m reading through these reviews & see that most people start on 25mg. The first few days my panic attacks got SEVERE. I had suicidal thoughts I never had before. I was constantly tense with fear, couldn’t eat or sleep. I almost went to the hospital. I was scared to be around family or out in public. It was AWFUL. I felt paralyzed. After 7 days I decided to stop taking it and have been in bed for the last two days. I’m already feeling SO much better but still feel like it needs to get out of my system more. I’m very traumatized. They say things can feel worse before it gets better but to me that is a very dangerous game to play!

I literally just took the pill for the first time last night, but I was curious what the first day was like, side-effect wise, so I am going to share for anyone else curious! It's been about 14 hours and here is what I noticed:1. I woke up about 5 times last night. And each time I woke up, it felt like I could just stay up and be fine for the rest of the day, but when I actually woke up to my alarm at a respectful time I was VERY tired.2. I have not had the nausea/diarrhea that has been mentioned (yet), but I am experiencing a bit of no appetite. The past 2 weeks I have been eating like crazy (I'm talking at LEAST 3000 calories a day...I'm a depressive eater), but today I couldn't finish my breakfast and now I'm just not hungry.3. I am irritable. One little comment at work, and I'm looking for a new job. This could be totally unrelated, but I feel like it's a little worse than usual.Anyways, it's not even been a full day so I will probably update again when more things come up.

Suffered with mild depression for as long as I can remember, was on sertraline for a good couple of years maybe 2 years ago, worked well. Just started taking them again a month ago, and the side effects are not good, faint, headaches, tired etc all the time. Tied between trying to hang on as I have read some start to feel better 6 weeks + when your body fully adapts to the sertraline, but on the other hand wanting to come off them so I don’t feel like this & thinking that the less time they are in my system the better for coming off them again. Been reading up about different batches and these are definitely different to the ones I had previous.

I have taken sertraline 3 times in my life. First time in 96 after a very big depression 25 years ago. This drug saved my life from suicidal thoughts. When I first took it I had a lot of nausea. The second time I took it was 4 years later after an other major depression and again it saved my life and I became gradually better and better, but this time I didn't the nausea.  After this I used sertraline again, an other couple of times to actually prevent major depressions when I felt extremely unhappy or after a tragedy.Sertraline saved my life. Thanks a million for everybody involved in the research of this drug .

Zoloft (sertraline):I literally felt something happy the first day. I'm not kidding. I took my first pill at 6:15 am....at/around 10:00am, I felt like I couldn't complete a sentence without thinking really hard about it... Then noon came, I got off early from work...I came home, and felt fantastic. I felt good. I'm very intune with my body. I can tell if I'm getting a cold sore days before I get one, and I can tell this/that just by taste in my mouth, or how I smell something. I take other meds, but this one, Zoloft, I actually felt something positive the first day. I believe this is going to be good for me. I used to take Paxil CR, but if I didn't take it absolutely on time, or whatever,...I was off for a week (or in jail).. no, I'm not kidding, my depression has taken me places you don't wanna know... My experience today is that I actually feel happier than I have in months... I guess I'm lucky that way! :)

Losing some one  close to me caused depression  so doctor  prescribed sertraline the thoughts of taking them scared me but I realised I needed help as I was not coping. So I took one 50mg tablet and it made me feel so sick  I couldn't eat anything I felt terrible so the next day decided not to carry on with the meds. After a week my depression got worse and I was not sleeping so phoned my doctor who told me if I wanted to get better I would need to persevere with the meds so I went back on them at a lower dose of 25mg for a week going up to 50mg the following week I started to feel better by day 10 but after just over 4 weeks of taking them I came out in red spots on my back and stomach my doctor said my body was  not tolerating  them so Doctor  said I had to stop  them  and had to go cold turkey I have now been off  them 2 weeks. I am now doing really well and finding counselling is helping me sertraline was working for me but due to a adverse reaction had to stop this medication

I was 14 years old when I first tried marijuana. I was a bit astonished how it made me feel. It lessened my depression and anger. I went on using it throughout my life although it made learning a little difficult at times. Then in 1997, I found myself in a deep depression from some business concerns and went to the doctor for a severe sore throat. I explained my situation and he prescribed Zoloft. When I woke up the next day, it felt like I was released from a dungeon. It was a feeling I’ve never experienced. I was calm, relaxed, and most of all I didn’t feel depressed and I couldn’t imagine having any anger concerns. It was later found that my mother had the same issues throughout her life all related to low serotonin. I continue to take 100 mg per day and have to say this drug has made my life so much better.

Zoloft (sertraline):Last February-April I had a really bad bout with anxiety and depression I tried Prozac and Cymbalta and had really bad side effects with both of them. I started 25mg of Zoloft in May 2020. About a Month later I went to 50mg and now am up to 75mg. I may even consider going to 100mg. The Anxiety was better pretty quickly...the fatigue/depression took a bit longer...still some improvement needed, but so much better. I have also noticed that my PMS is barely noticeable.  Very little to no agitation in the days before my period. My advice would be to increase slowly and allow time for improvement. It is gradual and can take months...but worth the wait.

Zoloft (sertraline):About 6 weeks ago, I started Zoloft at 25 mg for GAD, mild depression, and some PTSD and OCD symptoms. Before you continue reading, please understand that my experience likely will not be yours, as is the case with every single review you'll read. Do not be scared to start. It absolutely helped. My overall mood didn't change much, but it helped the physical symptoms of my anxiety and helped me cope with my life stresses. I began to enjoy doing things I love again. I still had bad days, but I was overall functioning well and productive, although I still had not the best outlook on life. Side effects I experienced: insomnia, daily headaches similar to hangovers, shakiness, increased depression the first week, decreased appetite, menstrual changes, and decreased libido. Again, this is just my experience. Do not be afraid to give it a try, people are much more likely to leave negative reviews, I just wanted to leave a review to help others. Best of luck, you've got this!

It helped me with with my suicidal thoughts and I'm a lot less anxious now, but it turned my depression into bipolar disorder and now I have a lot of anger management issues which worsened my social functioning. + I have to pee every hour, my ear is regularly ringing and I experienced cognitive dysfunction (its like I have severe dementia: a lot of times I can't process what others have said to me ,can't remember names, etc).

Zoloft (sertraline):I refuse to let what happened to me happen to anyone else. I’m 18 year old petite female. I began taking 25mg of zoloft for anxiety and mild depression. On day 3, I experienced serotonin shock syndrome. I woke up suddenly in the middle of the night with my entire body shaking, my heart rate extremely high, and extremely confused. My parents took me to the ER after I told them I felt like my life was ending. The physicians assistant in the ER dismissed me as a panic attack, even tho I’ve had anxiety my entire life and I have never felt close to way I did that night. My experience left me completely traumatized. I struggled to sleep for months afterward, terrified that I would wake up the same way. PLEASE PLEASE consider what you are putting in your body when you take this drug, especially if you’re a smaller person.

Dear guys,I am on Sertraline for a 5 days, it makes all my depression symptoms worse. By reading other reviews, I found out that I have to tolerate these symptoms at least for a month to improve. I have to give it time, but it really impacts on my life and pushed me to postpone all my duties. But I don't have another choices ?!

sertraline gave me a new life. I was suffering with depression, anxiety, social anxiety, negative thoughts, body dysmorphia... I tried counselling but it helps was very marginal... I now sleep in the night and I am more relaxed.I have mild side effects such as vivid dreams... I also thought one of them were numb legs but after the blood test I discovered I had a vitamin D deficiency and after taking vit d I feel so much better!Highly recommend to everyone who is struggling and suffering on a daily basis
sertraline worked a little bit,  not much no energy at all

Zoloft (sertraline):Surprisingly, positive effects from Zoloft started the next morning after taking my first 25mg dose at dinner the night before. I felt so good, I thought this is what normal is. I haven’t felt this good in I don’t know how long. My doctor offered counseling in addition to the Zoloft, but it works so well, I don’t think I need it.

Comments abound on this page regarding Sertraline's negative side effects. I don't understand why people bother to leave negative feedback as all side effects mentioned are in the information leaflet that come with the medication. Furthermore, most negative reviews are from folk who have not stayed on this medication long enough to experience anything positive. You need to give it at least 8 weeks to see the benefits, if you don't you may be missing a glorious opportunity to get better. Your doctor should tell you these things beforehand.

This is the second time I've taken Sertraline. The first was for panic attacks when I was 15. It worked wonderfully. The second time is now at almost 22, and I'm back on the 25mg dose. Within two times of taking, I could think clearly; my negative thoughts stopped; my anger almost disappeared. I highly recommend to anyone who feels like their brain has a million thoughts repeating; this gave me my life back.

Zoloft (sertraline):I have been taking Zoloft for several months. I have IBS which flares up when I'm anxious, and Zoloft really helps with that. It has very few side effects and I feel more like myself when I'm taking Zoloft. I do have one small complaint: when I miss a few consecutive doses I tend to get dizzy. But that's it! Other than that, I have no issues with Zoloft. It's very subtle, and it certainly has improved my mood.

Back in February I started having hot flushes, then felt dizzy and odd day a bit down, then a week later I had anxiety, which I had the same in 2007 when my mum died, so my doctor put my on sertraline,I went from a dose 25mg to 50mg and true for the first two months I had every side effect, head aches, blurred vision, cloudy brain, sick, anxiety, up and down days but came on this group to keep my positive and kept with them, now 5 months on I'm almost back to myself I do have odd days but that's life, and just get over it, so for anyone just starting sertraline, please be ready for a few weeks of feeling really rubbish but believe me u will soon start to feel better and it will work for u so hang in there, As we all deserve to be happy.

Zoloft (sertraline):I started taking zoloft after 8 months of post concussion syndrome symptoms.My anxiety and very low mood were affecting every aspect of my life. I was suicidal.I started with 50mg for the first month.Only side effects for me was a bit of nausea the first week and a lack of appetite. By week 4 we went up to 100mg and everything has improved significantly!I can separate emotions from facts which I couldn't do before. The people I thought were "against me" don't seem to bother me whatsoever now.I've gotten my life back. I have energy and an optimistic attitude. My friends and family have  noticed in big ways. It's been a life changed for me.The only thing I would say are side effectsLow libidoShortened Sleep. I usually wake up in the middle of the night now.

Zoloft (sertraline):I’m 50 and have struggled with anxiety because of my 26 year relationship with my wife. After 60 days I don’t have the breakdowns any more and can function. Zoloft helped me to close off to her and begin to feel safe emotionally. It really works.

I have been on sertraline for about 4 months. I had horrific side effects for 2 days including more severe depression, intrusive thoughts, nausea, diarrhoea. I persevered after reading reviews on this site. I didn’t feel any different for maybe 2 months, but now I feel amazing! I feel the best I ever have and I only had mild depression. I walk around with a smile on my face, no longer feel anxious in social situations and nothing seems insurmountable (and I went through recovery from surgery, a breakup and living with my ex through COVID lockdown on this medication). It’s a game changer for me! I’m on 50mg/day.  Give it time to work because it’s worth going through the horrific side effects to feel like I do. Just make sure you chose a good time to start (i.e. not a busy time at work or similar) because you may have to take a few days off work. Make sure you have support.

I have epilepsy, I take Lamictal, and Sertlaline. I've had very good results, no anxiety, no seizures. These medications make you feel a constant buzzing in your head, I'm used to it, but a lot of people can't handle it. I suggest that you start on a low dose band move up from there.

My experience with depression after several traumatic life events happened so physically,  and hit so hard I was convinced it could not be depression but that something must be wrong . I was also almost « manic » during my pms , completely off my rocker. My doctor prescribed 50mg of sertraline, first 2 days I felt like I was vibrating but it faded quickly , after a few weeks I didn’t feel any real improvement so my doctor increased to 100mg again a little vibraty for the first day or 2 , then slowly after a few weeks I noticed I was feeling somewhat better ! I could go to the grocery store ! I was able to clean my kitchen ! Without needing a nap ! I still wasn’t quite there after a few weeks , (need to be more functioning) so increased to 150mg . I’m hoping after reading these reviews that this will do the trick. I am also in therapy weekly. I take it at supper time which I was recommended by pharmacist .

I have major/severe depression and have been on a variety of SSRI's/SSNRI's/NDRI's and Sertraline is great but for a few wrong reasons. The anxiety/OCD/rage was worse than the depression though. I've been on Sertraline (100mg) for a collective 4 years and its pretty much done the same thing: It ELIMINATES anxiety, OCD and rage/anger issues. It's better than benzos in doing it as well. The problem is what is doesn't do: For me, it had no effect on the depression/mood (which was the point?). Side effects: Fatigue (like a zombie), yawning, feeling disconnected, and makes you have terrible quality sleep.If you're a male, it makes it difficult to ejaculate.In closing, I would use this for major anxiety/OCD/PTSD/anger issues, but it doesn't lift your mood. Side effects aside, it will change your life, but please get a sleeping tablet as well.

I have been it for about 5 years now and thankfully I have had no side effects. I take two 100mg  sertraline at night and been working great. I have tried others ( Lost count how many ) but never worked. It's been hit and miss till I was prescribed Sertraline. That was heaven sent.

I am so thankful for these reviews otherwise I probably wouldn’t have persevered as long as I did on Sertraline. I was in deep despair and anxiety following a few traumatic life events, In bad way. Put on 50mgs and first week or so got an amazing effect but that stopped. Up and down over the next 4 weeks then up to 100, On that for 8 weeks  and again happy a few days, low a few days. Felt it maybe wasn’t working which I was distraught about, but these reviews really helped. So many times I thought about giving up but many reviews said to persevere. Side effects of nausea/increased anxiety can be horrible but isn’t 24/7. Propanolol 10mgs and diazepam 2mgs helped.  Up to 150mg and again happy days bad days. Nearly gave up again. Now been on 150mg over 8 wks and eureka! Happy, calm, positive, sociable, fun. So if this sounds like you, please please persevere! Get help and support through it and ignore when people say takes 4-6 wks. That’s taken me nearly 6 months, but wow it’s worth it!

Zoloft (sertraline):I started taking sertraline around 5 weeks ago today (25mg). The first few days were fine, I only had a bad stomach for a day or so. However at around week 2 I felt awful, was having extreme suicidal thoughts. I carried on taking the medication as I know it gets a lot worse before it gets better.
